intro: Orthosiphon incurvus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurry, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, waxy leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic properties.
